com.pi4j.component.potentiometer.microchip.impl

Class MicrochipPotentiometerBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pi4j.component.ComponentBase
      • com.pi4j.component.potentiometer.microchip.impl.MicrochipPotentiometerBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, MicrochipPotentiometer, Potentiometer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MCP4431, MCP4432, MCP4441, MCP4442, MCP4451, MCP4452, MCP4461, MCP4462, MCP4531, MCP4532, MCP4541, MCP4542, MCP4551, MCP4552, MCP4561, MCP4562, MCP4631, MCP4632, MCP4641, MCP4642, MCP4651, MCP4652, MCP4661, MCP4662

    public abstract class MicrochipPotentiometerBase
extends ComponentBase
implements MicrochipPotentiometer
    Abstract Pi4J-device for MCP45XX and MCP46XX ICs.
    Author:
    Raspelikan
    See Also:
    MCP4561, MCP4651

    • Field Detail

      • PIN_NOT_AVAILABLE

        protected static final boolean PIN_NOT_AVAILABLE
        The value which is used for address-bit if the device's package does not provide a matching address-pin (see 6.2.4)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INITIALVALUE_LOADED_FROM_EEPROM

        protected static final int INITIALVALUE_LOADED_FROM_EEPROM
        The value which is used for devices capable of non-volatile wipers. For those devices the initial value is loaded from EEPROM.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • nonVolatileMode

        protected MicrochipPotentiometerNonVolatileMode nonVolatileMode
        Whether to use the volatile or the non-volatile wiper

    • Constructor Detail

      • MicrochipPotentiometerBase

        protected MicrochipPotentiometerBase(I2CBus i2cBus,
                                     boolean pinA0,
                                     boolean pinA1,
                                     boolean pinA2,
                                     MicrochipPotentiometerChannel channel,
                                     MicrochipPotentiometerNonVolatileMode nonVolatileMode,
                                     int initialValueForVolatileWipers)
                              throws IOException
        Builds an instance which is ready to use.
        Parameters:
        i2cBus - The Pi4J-I2CBus to which the device is connected to
        pinA0 - Whether the device's address pin A0 is high (true) or low (false)
        pinA1 - Whether the device's address pin A1 (if available) is high (true) or low (false)
        pinA2 - Whether the device's address pin A2 (if available) is high (true) or low (false)
        channel - Which of the potentiometers provided by the device to control
        nonVolatileMode - The way non-volatile reads or writes are done
        initialValueForVolatileWipers - The value for devices which are not capable of non-volatile wipers
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • MicrochipPotentiometerBase

        protected MicrochipPotentiometerBase(I2CBus i2cBus,
                                     boolean pinA0,
                                     boolean pinA1,
                                     boolean pinA2,
                                     MicrochipPotentiometerChannel channel,
                                     MicrochipPotentiometerNonVolatileMode nonVolatileMode,
                                     int initialValueForVolatileWipers,
                                     MicrochipPotentiometerDeviceControllerFactory controllerFactory)
                              throws IOException
        Builds an instance which is ready to use.
        Parameters:
        i2cBus - The Pi4J-I2CBus to which the device is connected to
        pinA0 - Whether the device's address pin A0 is high (true) or low (false)
        pinA1 - Whether the device's address pin A1 (if available) is high (true) or low (false)
        pinA2 - Whether the device's address pin A2 (if available) is high (true) or low (false)
        channel - Which of the potentiometers provided by the device to control
        nonVolatileMode - The way non-volatile reads or writes are done
        initialValueForVolatileWipers - The value for devices which are not capable of non-volatile wipers
        controllerFactory - builds new controllers
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result
        See Also:
        MicrochipPotentiometerDefaultDeviceControllerFactory

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize(int initialValueForVolatileWipers)
                   throws IOException
        Initializes the wiper to a defined status. For devices capable of non-volatile-wipers the non-volatile-value is loaded. For devices not capable the given value is set in the device.
        Parameters:
        initialValueForVolatileWipers - The initial value for devices not capable
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • buildI2CAddress

        protected static int buildI2CAddress(boolean pinA0,
                                     boolean pinA1,
                                     boolean pinA2)
        Parameters:
        pinA0 - Whether the device's address pin A0 is high (true) or low (false)
        pinA1 - Whether the device's address pin A1 (if available) is high (true) or low (false)
        pinA2 - Whether the device's address pin A2 (if available) is high (true) or low (false)
        Returns:
        The I2C-address based on the address-pins given

      • setNonVolatileMode

        protected void setNonVolatileMode(MicrochipPotentiometerNonVolatileMode nonVolatileMode)
        The visibility of this method is protected because not all devices support non-volatile wipers. Any derived class may publish this method.
        Parameters:
        nonVolatileMode - The way non-volatile reads or writes are done

        Returns:
        The wiper's current value
        Throws:

      • getNonVolatileValue

        protected int getNonVolatileValue()
                           throws IOException
        The visibility of this method is protected because not all devices support non-volatile wipers. Any derived class may publish this method.
        Returns:
        The non-volatile-wiper's value.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • getCurrentValue

        public int getCurrentValue()
                    throws IOException
        The wiper's value read from cache. The cache is updated on any modifying action or the method 'updateCacheFromDevice'.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentValue in interface Potentiometer
        Returns:
        The wipers current value
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result
        See Also:
        updateCacheFromDevice()

      • setCurrentValue

        public void setCurrentValue(int value)
                     throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Potentiometer
        Set wiper's value. Values from 0 to 'maxValue' are valid. Values above or below this boundaries are corrected quietly.
        Specified by:
        setCurrentValue in interface Potentiometer
        Parameters:
        value - The wiper's value to be set
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result
        See Also:
        Potentiometer.getMaxValue()

      • setWiperLock

        public void setWiperLock(boolean enabled)
                  throws IOException
        Enables or disables wiper-lock. See chapter 5.3.
        Specified by:
        setWiperLock in interface MicrochipPotentiometer
        Parameters:
        enabled - wiper-lock for the poti's channel has to be enabled
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • setWriteProtection

        public void setWriteProtection(boolean enabled)
                        throws IOException
        Enables or disables write-protection for devices capable of non-volatile memory. Enabling write-protection does not only protect non-volatile wipers it also protects any other non-volatile information stored (f.e. wiper-locks).
        Specified by:
        setWriteProtection in interface MicrochipPotentiometer
        Parameters:
        enabled - write-protection has to be enabled
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Tests whether a given object equals to this object.

        Especially to any class deriving PotentiometerImpl this test does not take properties into account which do not point to a specific device/channel.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The other object
        Returns:
        Whether the other object equals to this object.
